original: Ekholm, Fritz August, folkskollärare, Åtvidaberg, f. 29/4/87 i Linköp. av P. A. E. o. Karin Olsson. G. 19 m. Karin Sandberg. Barn: Per-Axel f. 20, arkit. SAR, Per-Erik 27, fdk stud. — Linköp. fo’lksk:sem. 10-14. Anst. h. Neuman & Co. i Linköp. 04-09, lär. v. Smedjebackens folksk. 14, fodkiskodl i Åtvidaberg sed. 15, platsred. i Åtvidaberg f. öistergötk Folkbl. 21-35, plats-red. f. Ö’Stgöten fr. 36. Riksdagsman hiöislrikisd’. 41, liaindstingsmian iSied. 22, i ländsk. förv:utsk. sed. 43, led. av styr. f. Lunnevads folkhögsk. ised. 30, exp. i Åtvidabergs ar b :komm. 20-44, led. av distr :styr. f. SAP 27-46, led. av is’tyr. f. Åtvids hush:fören. sed. 22, ordf. sed. 37, bibi. i Åtvids folkbibi. sed. 19, ordf. i Åtvidabergs munic:fullim. 21-36, ied. av munic :ndn 20-46, ordf. 36-46, ordf. i kyrkofullm. 32-38.
translated: Ekholm, Fritz August, teacher, born on April 29, 1887 in Linköping to parents P.A.E. and Karin Olsson. Married Karin Sandberg in 1919 and had two sons: Per-Axel, born in 1920, an architect and SAR member, and Per-Erik, born in 1927, a student of fashion design. Attended the teacher training program at Linköping Folk High School from 1910-1914. Employed by Neuman & Co. in Linköping from 1904-1909. Taught at Smedjebacken Folk High School in 1914, became a primary school principal in Åtvidaberg in 1915, and was the editor of the local newspaper Östergötlands Folkblad from 1921-1935, and then became editor of Östgöten from 1936 onwards. Served as a member of parliament for the Social Democratic Party from 1941, a member of the county council of Östergötland from 1922, and a member of the local government committee from 1943. Also served as a board member of the Lunnevad Folk High School from 1930, as an executive member of the Åtvidabergs ar b: council from 1920-1944, as a district board member of the Social Democratic Party from 1927-1946, as a board member of the Åtvids hush: association from 1922, and as its chairman from 1937. Acted as the librarian of the Åtvids public library since 1919, was the chairman of the Åtvidaberg Municipal Council from 1921-1936, and was a member of the municipal committee from 1920-1946, serving as its chairman from 1936 to 1946. Also served as the chairman of the church council from 1932-1938.
